section.title: Evaluation of Static Source Code Checkers
section.p: There are multiple commonly used tools in Open Source projects.
Splint is probably the most used checker. It seamlessly integrates into the Visual C++ IDE. See the following documentation: . Unfortunately it is limited to C and is not able to parse C++ code.
Cppcheck is another Open Source software, which is able to parse C++ code. It is available under: .

ol.li: Download and install the tool. Add the %PATH% variable accordingly.
Go to the BUSMASTER sources folder.

Execute cppcheck -I. --enable=all %SOURCE_FILES% on the respective files. If you have git-bash or cygwin installed, you can do it over all cpp and h files using find -name "*.[cpp|h]" | xargs cppcheck -I. --enable=all *.cpp *.h.
